perturbation.original_text: Bravatek agrees to serve as a non-exclusive project sales lead finder for COMPANY. In this capacity, Bravatek will use its best efforts to provide the following services to COMPANY. a. Promote, market and introduce the Products to prospective clients in the government space nationwide.
perturbation.changed_text: Bravatek agrees to serve as a non-exclusive project sales lead generator for COMPANY. In this capacity, Bravatek will use its commercially reasonable efforts to provide the following services to COMPANY. a. Promote, market and introduce the Items to prospective clients in the government space nationwide.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'lead finder' to 'lead generator' implies a more active role, while weakening 'best efforts' to 'commercially reasonable efforts' lowers the standard of performance. Changing 'Products' to 'Items' creates confusion about what is being promoted.

perturbation.original_text: COMPANY agrees to use its best efforts to promote and support project lead finding and after-sales support of Bravatek by:   a. Listing Bravatek in all appropriate sales and marketing materials as a non-exclusive alliance partner (with focus of government customers)   b. Provide timely responses to both technical and administrative questions posed by Bravatek.
perturbation.changed_text: COMPANY agrees to use its commercially acceptable efforts to promote and support project lead generation and after-sales support of Bravatek by:   a. Listing Bravatek in some sales and marketing materials as a non-exclusive associate (with focus of government clients)   b. Provide reasonably prompt responses to both technical and administrative queries posed by Bravatek.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'best efforts' to 'commercially acceptable efforts' significantly reduces the required level of effort. 'Lead finding' becomes 'lead generation', which conflicts with Bravatek's modified role. Changing 'alliance partner' to 'associate' diminishes the relationship, while 'customers' become 'clients'. 'Timely' becomes 'reasonably prompt', creating ambiguity. 'Questions' becomes 'queries'.

perturbation.original_text: For any Product or Solution sold to any perspective clients introduced by Bravatek registered with COMPANY via email to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-designated distribution affiliate(s) or sales channel(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-finder fee, to be mutually discussed and finally decided by COMPANY at the range of minimum of 10% to maximum of 20% of project revenue, with an exact fee to be depending upon the overall project sales margin and cost of development and delivery of each project, payable NET 30 days after each client payment on delivered products received at COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.changed_text: For any Item or Resolution sold to any future consumers introduced by Bravatek documented with COMPANY via written notice to COMPANY's CEO and delivered through Bravatek or a COMPANY-approved distribution partner(s) or sales pipeline(s), Bravatek will receive a lead-generator bonus, to be solely determined by COMPANY at the rate of approximately 10% to 20% of project profit, with the specific bonus amount contingent upon the total project earnings and price of design and production of each project, payable 45 days following each consumer remittance on furnished items deposited into COMPANY's bank account.
perturbation.explanation: The original terms 'Product', 'Solution', 'perspective clients', 'registered', 'lead-finder fee', 'mutually discussed and finally decided', 'project revenue', 'project sales margin', and 'NET 30 days' have been swapped to 'Item', 'Resolution', 'future consumers', 'documented', 'lead-generator bonus', 'solely determined', 'project profit', 'total project earnings', and '45 days'. This change creates uncertainty and contradiction.
